divs: sighting detailsi was at work and went outside for a cigarette. i was outside for just a few seconds and i looked up in the sky across the street above a housing development. i just automatically looked up directly at it just on the other side of the trees. it was a gigantic ball of yellow\orange light! my very first thought was "is that the moon? what is it doing in the northwest? why is it so huge?" i stood there staring and straining to see for about 2 or 3 minutes trying to find markings and craters. i knew it couldn't be the moon, but i looked for craters anyway. there was none, none at all. then it hit me and i thought to myself "wait a minute, i saw the moon earlier and it's path goes over the back of the building! the moon wasn't full, it still had a slice missing, and it was white, not orange!" i became very excited and happy! i greeted the craft and asked if it would come over here so i may see them and meet them. perceptually from my point of view, this light was very large and bright. as a means of comparison this light was about 4 to 5 times the size of the sun perceptually. the altitude was maybe about 500 to 600 feet up at most and it was silent. the distance from me was less than 1\4 of a mile. after about 10 minutes it started to very slowly drift away towards the northwest. when the craft's light itself was completely out of view, after watching it for at least 15 to 20 minutes, i could still see it lighting up the sky for at least a further 5 minutes. when it completely left towards the northwest all the lights in the area blinked off for less than a second. this includes the street lamps, the lights at work, and the lights in the houses across the street. i could only assume the reason for this is that the electrogravitic propulsion system kicked in and pulsed an electromagnetic field that disrupted the area. this light was so big and bright that i could not see the craft itself. while the light was still in full view, i called a co-worker that was to come in and relieve me. i told him to "get here as quickly as possible because there is an extraterrestrial craft across the street! it is huge, orange, it is lighting up the sky, and it is gorgeous!!��� this was at 5:58am. about 5 to 10 minutes after that phone call it was completely gone. the whole event was mesmerizing. it always is no matter how many times i see a craft. every time i see a craft i'm always happy. sometimes i'm excited and some times i'm peaceful and calm. i am never afraid. my heart is still fluttering from it even now. still now i can think of little else than that craft. who was it? what were they doing? were they dropping some one off? where are they from and where are they going? i very much wanted to see and meet the people inside the craft. tonight i have my digital still camera, my digital video camera, and a flashlight so i can get their attention. unfortunately the video cam has no battery charge to it, but the still camera has brand new batteries. every time i go outside, i look all over the sky, but especially in that same area���.. hoping it returns���..
